name: POPC Clinical Form
description: A form used to capture pediatric clinical Cases

questions.label: What was the length of the pregnancy with this child?
Were there any complications during the pregnancy
Did the mother take any drugs/alcohol /smoking during pregnancy?
What was this childs gestation at birth
Was there maternal fever or premature rupture of membranes?
Did the child have any neonatal problems?
Was the baby treated on the special care baby unit?
Have there been any concerns about development, vision, hearing?
Any infections and illnesses has the child had?
Does the child have chronic condition ?
Is the child on any medication?
Is the child seeing another clinician?

answers.label: Stage 4 (Increased size of penis with  growth in breadth, scrotum  skin darker)
Stage 4 (Areola and papilla form a secondary mound above level of breast)
Stage 2 (Sparse growth of long, slightly pigmented hair)
Stage 3 (Darker, coarser and more curled hair spreading sparsely over junction of pubes)
Stage 4 (Hair adult in type, but covering smaller area than in adult)
